GT.content: for Heidegger, importance of rethinking time, privileged horizon for reelaboration of Being
GT.linkedContent: for Heidegger, importance of rethinking time, privileged horizon for reelaboration of Being

GT.content: Blanchot says, more or less, forgetting is another name for Being
GT.linkedContent: Blanchot says, more or less, forgetting is another name for Being

OOG.content: “access to Being and Being’s arrival must always already be contracted [stricture] or drawn together when phenomenology begins by claiming the right to speak (droit à parole)” > prescribing historicity for Being avoids simple misfortune of delay: phenomenology alone can open absolute subjectivity of Sense to Being-History, as auto-temporalization of Living Present
OOG.linkedContent: “access to Being and Being’s arrival must always already be contracted [stricture] or drawn together when phenomenology begins by claiming the right to speak (droit à parole)” > prescribing historicity for Being avoids simple misfortune of delay: phenomenology alone can open absolute subjectivity of Sense to Being-History, as auto-temporalization of Living Present

OOG.content: delay is thus philosophical absolute, and absolute origin in general
OOG.linkedContent: delay is thus philosophical absolute, and absolute origin in general

HERP.content: Being is gathering (versammelt) [of the same]—logos > transitivity of “ist”: that it gathers
HERP.linkedContent: Being is gathering (versammelt) [of the same]—logos > transitivity of “ist”: that it gathers

BL.content: guardian of law resembles shepherd of Being [?] (still hidden/guarded abyss of difference)
BL.linkedContent: guardian of law resembles shepherd of Being [?] (still hidden/guarded abyss of difference)

HASD.content: plus d’être: beyond and more than being [hyper, beyond]
where does order to remain silent take place? the place is Being, Being reduced to a threshold, outer sanctuary (parvis) of temple, sacred place
HASD.linkedContent: where does order to remain silent take place? the place is Being, Being reduced to a threshold, outer sanctuary (parvis) of temple, sacred place

MPM.content: Heidegger links law & Being in Hölderlin, de Man contests
MPM.linkedContent: Heidegger links law & Being in Hölderlin, de Man contests

MPM.content: Derrida adds: impossible to reduce a thinking of the law to a thinking of Being
MPM.linkedContent: Derrida adds: impossible to reduce a thinking of the law to a thinking of Being

MPM.content: promise prohibits the gathering of Being in presence (as its condition), the condition of the possibility and impossibility of eschatology, ironic allegory of messianism
MPM.linkedContent: promise prohibits the gathering of Being in presence (as its condition), the condition of the possibility and impossibility of eschatology, ironic allegory of messianism

EM.content: [re: Sartre’s Being and Nothing…] unity of Being means totality of beings
EM.linkedContent: [re: Sartre’s Being and Nothing…] unity of Being means totality of beings

EM.content: (144)“l’être” et la langue est le nom de ce qui assure ce passage par le nous entre la métaphysique et l’humanisme
EM.linkedContent: (144)“l’être” et la langue est le nom de ce qui assure ce passage par le nous entre la métaphysique et l’humanisme

EM.content: if we give up we-men (nous-hommes) in relation to metaphysical determinations (i.e. zōon logon ekhon, etc.), the proper of man remains inseparable from the question or truth of Being (this makes Heidegger’s Kehre even less pertinent)
EM.linkedContent: if we give up we-men (nous-hommes) in relation to metaphysical determinations (i.e. zōon logon ekhon, etc.), the proper of man remains inseparable from the question or truth of Being (this makes Heidegger’s Kehre even less pertinent)

EM.content: Being acknowledged as fact (Faktum) by way of phenomenological determination [principle of principles, presence] of exemplary being, Dasein
EM.linkedContent: Being acknowledged as fact (Faktum) by way of phenomenological determination [principle of principles, presence] of exemplary being, Dasein

EM.content: for Heidegger, exemplary interrogated (Befragte) being [man] constitutes privileged text for a reading of meaning of Being
EM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, exemplary interrogated (Befragte) being [man] constitutes privileged text for a reading of meaning of Being

EM.content: Heidegger: Being is nearest to man—but at beginning it’s farthest: man clings to beings
EM.linkedContent: Heidegger: Being is nearest to man—but at beginning it’s farthest: man clings to beings

EM.content: Being is nothing, not a being, cannot be said, cannot say itself, except in ontic metaphor
EM.linkedContent: Being is nothing, not a being, cannot be said, cannot say itself, except in ontic metaphor

EM.content: Heidegger: Being is the transcendens pure and simple, l’éclaircie (Lichtung) elle-même
EM.linkedContent: Heidegger: Being is the transcendens pure and simple, l’éclaircie (Lichtung) elle-même

EM.content: for Heidegger, “le proche, c’est le propre; le propre, c’est le plus proche (prope, proprius), l’homme est le proper de l’être, qui de tout près lui parle à l’oreille”
EM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, “le proche, c’est le propre; le propre, c’est le plus proche (prope, proprius), l’homme est le proper de l’être, qui de tout près lui parle à l’oreille”

EM.content: (161) isn’t security of near trembling today? that is, the co-belonging/co-propriety of the name of man and name of Being, as it inhabits and is inhabited by language of West, such as it is buried in its oikonomia [house, tomb see DIF p. 4n], such as it is forgotten, and such as it is awakened by destruction of ontotheology? [trembling: announcement of deconstruction]
EM.linkedContent: (161) isn’t security of near trembling today? that is, the co-belonging/co-propriety of the name of man and name of Being, as it inhabits and is inhabited by language of West, such as it is buried in its oikonomia [house, tomb see DIF p. 4n], such as it is forgotten, and such as it is awakened by destruction of ontotheology? [trembling: announcement of deconstruction]

SEC.content: take classical notion of writing, make it generalizable to all order of signs, and extend it even to experience of Being
SEC.linkedContent: take classical notion of writing, make it generalizable to all order of signs, and extend it even to experience of Being

VM.content: Heidegger says our thought has been desiccated, its return to Greek source, thought of Being, is a knowledge, security not in the world, possibility of our language & nexus of our world
VM.linkedContent: Heidegger says our thought has been desiccated, its return to Greek source, thought of Being, is a knowledge, security not in the world, possibility of our language & nexus of our world

VM.content: imperialism of theoria bothers Levinas: especially phenomenology’s infusion w/ light, way it predetermined Being as object
VM.linkedContent: imperialism of theoria bothers Levinas: especially phenomenology’s infusion w/ light, way it predetermined Being as object

VM.content: for Levinas, neutral thought of Being neutralizes Other as a being
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, neutral thought of Being neutralizes Other as a being

VM.content: philosophy “think[s] the metaphor in the silent horizon of the non-metaphor: Being”
VM.linkedContent: philosophy “think[s] the metaphor in the silent horizon of the non-metaphor: Being”

VM.content: acc. Levinas, Being has impoverished logic of “truism,” [?] valid for every existent except “the Other,” subordinates ethics to ontology,
VM.linkedContent: acc. Levinas, Being has impoverished logic of “truism,” [?] valid for every existent except “the Other,” subordinates ethics to ontology,

VM.content: if “truism” = analytic affirmation (poverty of tautology) > wouldn’t Being escape form of (banal) truism, where subject is repeated in predicate?; acc. Derrida, because Being is nothing outside existent, not an archia, it can’t precede (as Levinas wants to argue) the existent in time or dignity, can’t subordinate ethical relation to ontological one
VM.linkedContent: if “truism” = analytic affirmation (poverty of tautology) > wouldn’t Being escape form of (banal) truism, where subject is repeated in predicate?; acc. Derrida, because Being is nothing outside existent, not an archia, it can’t precede (as Levinas wants to argue) the existent in time or dignity, can’t subordinate ethical relation to ontological one

VM.content: every concept presupposes Being by dissimulating it, common root of essence & existence
VM.linkedContent: every concept presupposes Being by dissimulating it, common root of essence & existence

VM.content: l’être n’est que l’être-de cet étant et n’existe pas hors de lui comme une puissance étrangère
VM.linkedContent: l’être n’est que l’être-de cet étant et n’existe pas hors de lui comme une puissance étrangère

VM.content: Being is beyond hierarchies [beyond Nietzsche’s height?]
VM.linkedContent: Being is beyond hierarchies [beyond Nietzsche’s height?]

VM.content: Being is not even ontology or first philosophy in the sense of rank or excellence
VM.linkedContent: Being is not even ontology or first philosophy in the sense of rank or excellence

VM.content: nothing can enclose thought of Being (no ethics could be opened w/out it)
VM.linkedContent: nothing can enclose thought of Being (no ethics could be opened w/out it)

VM.content: if Being is radically foreign to ethics it is not as a counterethics, nor, as Levinas argues, is it a subordination of ethics to neutral violent power
VM.linkedContent: if Being is radically foreign to ethics it is not as a counterethics, nor, as Levinas argues, is it a subordination of ethics to neutral violent power

VM.content: Being conditions respect for the other, as what it is: other > w/out Being’s “laisser-être” (of ethical commandment, freedom) violence to such a degree it couldn’t appear or be named
VM.linkedContent: Being conditions respect for the other, as what it is: other > w/out Being’s “laisser-être” (of ethical commandment, freedom) violence to such a degree it couldn’t appear or be named

VM.content: Being is alone in resistance to every metaphor, neither above nor besides [no rank]
VM.linkedContent: Being is alone in resistance to every metaphor, neither above nor besides [no rank]

VM.content: acc. Derrida, Heidegger would not have accepted Levinas’s phrase “relation to the Being of existent,” nor his idea that “relation of Being of existent” [not a “relation of knowledge,” not a relation] would “dominate” “relation with an existent”
VM.linkedContent: acc. Derrida, Heidegger would not have accepted Levinas’s phrase “relation to the Being of existent,” nor his idea that “relation of Being of existent” [not a “relation of knowledge,” not a relation] would “dominate” “relation with an existent”

VM.content: Nietzsche and Renan reduce Heidegger’s Being to a metaphor by referring to its etymological association w/ respiration
VM.linkedContent: Nietzsche and Renan reduce Heidegger’s Being to a metaphor by referring to its etymological association w/ respiration

VM.content: Being is transcategorical, Heidegger would say of it what Levinas says of Other: “refractory to the category”
VM.linkedContent: Being is transcategorical, Heidegger would say of it what Levinas says of Other: “refractory to the category”

VM.content: Being makes search for an archia tremble, its priority is not an archia
VM.linkedContent: Being makes search for an archia tremble, its priority is not an archia

VM.content: Heidegger calls original dissimulation of Being beneath the existent, prior to any error in judgment, erring (Irren), every epoch is in an epoch of erring
VM.linkedContent: Heidegger calls original dissimulation of Being beneath the existent, prior to any error in judgment, erring (Irren), every epoch is in an epoch of erring

VM.content: Being “with” and “also” as existentiales, not categories
VM.linkedContent: Being “with” and “also” as existentiales, not categories

VM.content: is it risky of Levinas to think of Being as dominated by theme of unveiling when Heidegger continually affirms concealment?
VM.linkedContent: is it risky of Levinas to think of Being as dominated by theme of unveiling when Heidegger continually affirms concealment?

VM.content: w/ “epochs,” being-history, Heidegger permits reemergence of thought of eschatology: “Being itself…is in itself eschatological”; eschatology different from messianic eschatology in that w/ former war is not an accident that overcomes Being, war not even negative, war is Being itself
VM.linkedContent: w/ “epochs,” being-history, Heidegger permits reemergence of thought of eschatology: “Being itself…is in itself eschatological”; eschatology different from messianic eschatology in that w/ former war is not an accident that overcomes Being, war not even negative, war is Being itself

VM.content: Levinas seeks to oppose God to sacred divine, for God to be indicated in Space of Sacred, in light of deity > limit and wellspring (ressource) of finite-being as history: limit because God’s not there and wellspring because anticipation of thought of Being toujours voit venir Dieu
VM.linkedContent: Levinas seeks to oppose God to sacred divine, for God to be indicated in Space of Sacred, in light of deity > limit and wellspring (ressource) of finite-being as history: limit because God’s not there and wellspring because anticipation of thought of Being toujours voit venir Dieu

VM.content: “ontological” anticipation, transcendence toward Being, helps us understand God, even as ether in which dissonance resonates > inhabits & founds language, Mitsein, all Being-together
VM.linkedContent: “ontological” anticipation, transcendence toward Being, helps us understand God, even as ether in which dissonance resonates > inhabits & founds language, Mitsein, all Being-together

VM.content: Being is never identical, it is history, it dissimulates itself in its occurrence
VM.linkedContent: Being is never identical, it is history, it dissimulates itself in its occurrence

VM.content: God other name of Being? opens difference not simply indicated in it? ontic content of infinity would destroy ontic closure > would this not permit thought of Being, wouldn’t thought of Being be presupposed in thought of God?
VM.linkedContent: God other name of Being? opens difference not simply indicated in it? ontic content of infinity would destroy ontic closure > would this not permit thought of Being, wouldn’t thought of Being be presupposed in thought of God?

VM.content: Malebranche says Being is infinitely slight because infinite; Heidegger says Being is nothing (determined), produced in difference (as difference), that it is produced “in simultaneity with” Nothingness, it is “finite in its essence” [VP p. 87 the infinite differance is finite]
VM.linkedContent: Malebranche says Being is infinitely slight because infinite; Heidegger says Being is nothing (determined), produced in difference (as difference), that it is produced “in simultaneity with” Nothingness, it is “finite in its essence” [VP p. 87 the infinite differance is finite]

VM.content: Heidegger: “strange simplicity” of thought of Being
VM.linkedContent: Heidegger: “strange simplicity” of thought of Being

VM.content: question about Being not only introduces question about existent-God, it supposes God as possibility of its question, answer w/in its question > God implied in every question about God, precedes every “method” > content of thought of God is that of a being about which no question could be asked (except by being asked by it)
VM.linkedContent: question about Being not only introduces question about existent-God, it supposes God as possibility of its question, answer w/in its question > God implied in every question about God, precedes every “method” > content of thought of God is that of a being about which no question could be asked (except by being asked by it)

VM.content: Aristotle rigorously demonstrated that Being is neither genre nor principle (Metaphysics B, 3, 998 b 20)
VM.linkedContent: Aristotle rigorously demonstrated that Being is neither genre nor principle (Metaphysics B, 3, 998 b 20)

VM.content: doctrine of uniformity of Being (don Scotus, Heidegger) incompatible w/ Aristotelian-Thomist Being in which question of 1st/2nd [re: universal/singular] remains
VM.linkedContent: doctrine of uniformity of Being (don Scotus, Heidegger) incompatible w/ Aristotelian-Thomist Being in which question of 1st/2nd [re: universal/singular] remains

PAS.content: if being is another name for forgetting, places forgetting in a crypt, forgets forgetting, in naming forgetting one makes it disappear under its name [(un)names], vs. pas sous le nom d’oubli > le reste sans reste de cet effacement qui ne s’efface plus, voilà ce qu’il y a peut-être, par chance, mais qui n’est pas ou qui est pas
PAS.linkedContent: if being is another name for forgetting, places forgetting in a crypt, forgets forgetting, in naming forgetting one makes it disappear under its name [(un)names], vs. pas sous le nom d’oubli > le reste sans reste de cet effacement qui ne s’efface plus, voilà ce qu’il y a peut-être, par chance, mais qui n’est pas ou qui est pas

VP.content: Heidegger tells us that “to be” is enigmatically determined by philosophy via 3<sup><small>rd</small></sup> person of present indicative
VP.linkedContent: Heidegger tells us that “to be” is enigmatically determined by philosophy via 3rd person of present indicative

VP.content: “Being” is the first or last word to resist deconstruction of a language of words
VP.linkedContent: “Being” is the first or last word to resist deconstruction of a language of words

S.content: avoidance, denegation, categories of psychoanalysis, inadequate when it comes to questions of Being
S.linkedContent: avoidance, denegation, categories of psychoanalysis, inadequate when it comes to questions of Being

S.content: acc. Heidegger, Descartes, Husserl, both dogmatic, their concepts not ontologically clarified via Being
S.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, Descartes, Husserl, both dogmatic, their concepts not ontologically clarified via Being

S.content: for Heidegger, signature of thought never individual, commits via community, people, in his or her own language; there are only some languages open to Being: German, Greek
S.linkedContent: for Heidegger, signature of thought never individual, commits via community, people, in his or her own language; there are only some languages open to Being: German, Greek

TC.content: for Artaud, like Nietzsche, life beyond being, “the beyond of being,” Being as eternal repetition, ideal referral, victory of God/Death over life [cf. PS pp. 192-95]
TC.linkedContent: for Artaud, like Nietzsche, life beyond being, “the beyond of being,” Being as eternal repetition, ideal referral, victory of God/Death over life [cf. PS pp. 192-95]

T.content: Being, understood as [philosophy’s] proper, assures w/out let up (sans relâche) the relevant of reappropriation, the law of its proper weave (tissu), the economy of its representation
T.linkedContent: Being, understood as [philosophy’s] proper, assures w/out let up (sans relâche) the relevant of reappropriation, the law of its proper weave (tissu), the economy of its representation

T.content: Being [one reading of it] assures permeable/transparent continuity, logos posits/negates itself en laissant sourdre sa propre voix
T.linkedContent: Being [one reading of it] assures permeable/transparent continuity, logos posits/negates itself en laissant sourdre sa propre voix

T.content: resistance to deconstruction: infinite mastery > assurance of Being & interiorization of every limit as being, as its own proper
T.linkedContent: resistance to deconstruction: infinite mastery > assurance of Being & interiorization of every limit as being, as its own proper

PPHS.content: when Being is presence, sign can only be a transition, lieu de passage, (provisional) bridge btwn 2 moments of full presence, the bridge can be relevé
PPHS.linkedContent: when Being is presence, sign can only be a transition, lieu de passage, (provisional) bridge btwn 2 moments of full presence, the bridge can be relevé

PPHS.content: theory of sign on basis of being-present, authority of l’être-en-vue: telos of reappropriation [see POOF p. 65], coordination of sign & light of parousia, speaking logos as close as possible to itself in concept & consciousness
PPHS.linkedContent: theory of sign on basis of being-present, authority of l’être-en-vue: telos of reappropriation [see POOF p. 65], coordination of sign & light of parousia, speaking logos as close as possible to itself in concept & consciousness

DS.content: at the edge of being (au bord de l’être): the entre of the hymen, masked gap, veil of virginity (where nothing’s taken place) & consummation, penetration of antre, release [one in the other] > mirror never passed through, ice never broke, at the edge of being
DS.linkedContent: at the edge of being (au bord de l’être): the entre of the hymen, masked gap, veil of virginity (where nothing’s taken place) & consummation, penetration of antre, release [one in the other] > mirror never passed through, ice never broke, at the edge of being

DS.content: casting aside (mise à l’écart) of being defines/imprints itself in dissemination, as dissemination
DS.linkedContent: casting aside (mise à l’écart) of being defines/imprints itself in dissemination, as dissemination

OS.content: Heidegger’s question of Being seeks to destroy vulgar concept of time by repeating and interrogating it > that Being is ousia, parousia, Anwesenheit w/ regard to idea of time as Gegenwart (the present)
OS.linkedContent: Heidegger’s question of Being seeks to destroy vulgar concept of time by repeating and interrogating it > that Being is ousia, parousia, Anwesenheit w/ regard to idea of time as Gegenwart (the present)

OS.content: vulgar time as gegenwärtigen Besitze (always present possession), the having (Habe) of Being, its permanent presence
OS.linkedContent: vulgar time as gegenwärtigen Besitze (always present possession), the having (Habe) of Being, its permanent presence

OS.content: [via Heidegger] Beings are what is (must not be affected by time): privilege of 3rd person indicative (is, estin), as present participle becomes noun > same for consciousness
OS.linkedContent: [via Heidegger] Beings are what is (must not be affected by time): privilege of 3rd person indicative (is, estin), as present participle becomes noun > same for consciousness

OS.content: Aristotle repeats aporia of Zeno’s argument re: time, says it clarifies nothing, but does not deconstruct it > time’s nonbeing pre-comprehended as nonpresence in relation to determination of being as present
OS.linkedContent: Aristotle repeats aporia of Zeno’s argument re: time, says it clarifies nothing, but does not deconstruct it > time’s nonbeing pre-comprehended as nonpresence in relation to determination of being as present

OS.content: for Aristotle, being-together [of nun and stigmē] not a determination of Being but very production of Being > ama as the pivot (cheville) (clavis), the key opening & closing metaphysics > this complicity so self-effacing as to barely be noticed, the common origin of space & time
OS.linkedContent: for Aristotle, being-together [of nun and stigmē] not a determination of Being but very production of Being > ama as the pivot (cheville) (clavis), the key opening & closing metaphysics > this complicity so self-effacing as to barely be noticed, the common origin of space & time

POS.content: to “deconstruct” faithful/violent to philosophy, a certain textual work that produces great pleasure, a writing interested in itself that enables us to read philosophemes as symptoms (a word Derrida suspects), the symptom of thinking Being as presence [via Heidegger]
POS.linkedContent: to “deconstruct” faithful/violent to philosophy, a certain textual work that produces great pleasure, a writing interested in itself that enables us to read philosophemes as symptoms (a word Derrida suspects), the symptom of thinking Being as presence [via Heidegger]

ATIA.content: fundamental question of Being through response to/with, before/after the animal
ATIA.linkedContent: fundamental question of Being through response to/with, before/after the animal

ATIA.content: via Valéry’s snake, the “animal abyss” is not a void, it’s too full of being, vertigo, étincelle au lieu de néant, lieu tenant du néant que je suis
ATIA.linkedContent: via Valéry’s snake, the “animal abyss” is not a void, it’s too full of being, vertigo, étincelle au lieu de néant, lieu tenant du néant que je suis

Gii.content: Heidegger’s es gibt goes beyond question of meaning of Being, w/out overturning it
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger’s es gibt goes beyond question of meaning of Being, w/out overturning it

REST.content: praise for Heidegger’s Es gibt, Sein starting from (returning to) Es gibt Sein
REST.linkedContent: praise for Heidegger’s Es gibt, Sein starting from (returning to) Es gibt Sein

REST.content: for Heidegger, in Origin, the abyss (Abgrund) plays itself out like “veiled” destiny (fatum) which transfixes (transit) being
REST.linkedContent: for Heidegger, in Origin, the abyss (Abgrund) plays itself out like “veiled” destiny (fatum) which transfixes (transit) being

REST.content: certain thinking/experience of nothingness (nonexistent) is required to question being of existent, and the difference of being and existent
REST.linkedContent: certain thinking/experience of nothingness (nonexistent) is required to question being of existent, and the difference of being and existent

REST.content: for Heidegger, cette pensée du néant alien to science, which deals only w/ existents: belongs to philosophy/poetry > nonexistent, there w/out being there as being present, a kind of haunting: Unhemlichekeit is condition of question of being, pivot (cheville) of the essence (see OS)
REST.linkedContent: for Heidegger, cette pensée du néant alien to science, which deals only w/ existents: belongs to philosophy/poetry > nonexistent, there w/out being there as being present, a kind of haunting: Unhemlichekeit is condition of question of being, pivot (cheville) of the essence (see OS)

RM.content: when Heidegger says “House of Being,” it’s less so the house can determine Being, more so we can rethink the house
RM.linkedContent: when Heidegger says “House of Being,” it’s less so the house can determine Being, more so we can rethink the house

RM.content: this is an unheimlich maneuver, not pure inversion, outside the familial transport of colloquial metaphor (rethinks economic value & the proper, not a judicative statement: “S is P”)
RM.linkedContent: this is an unheimlich maneuver, not pure inversion, outside the familial transport of colloquial metaphor (rethinks economic value & the proper, not a judicative statement: “S is P”)

RM.content: Being, which is nothing: makes possible metaphoricity & its withdrawal
RM.linkedContent: Being, which is nothing: makes possible metaphoricity & its withdrawal

EJQB.content: the encounter (rencontre) is separation (breaks unity of Being by welcoming [accueillant] other into source of meaning) > contredit la “logique,” dans le fragile chaînon du “est”
EJQB.linkedContent: the encounter (rencontre) is separation (breaks unity of Being by welcoming [accueillant] other into source of meaning) > contredit la “logique,” dans le fragile chaînon du “est”

EJQB.content: only possible to say this by conceptualizing meaning, which is exile from Being, Being never is, never shows itself, never present, is never now
EJQB.linkedContent: only possible to say this by conceptualizing meaning, which is exile from Being, Being never is, never shows itself, never present, is never now

EJQB.content: nonquestion, act of faith, unpenetrated certainty that Being is a Grammar, world is in all its parts a cryptogram [this nonquestion not yet a dogma]
EJQB.linkedContent: nonquestion, act of faith, unpenetrated certainty that Being is a Grammar, world is in all its parts a cryptogram [this nonquestion not yet a dogma]

EJQB.content: born only by approaching book, die only by failing (échouant) in sight of book > toujours la rive impassible du livre est d’abord
EJQB.linkedContent: born only by approaching book, die only by failing (échouant) in sight of book > toujours la rive impassible du livre est d’abord

EJQB.content: the Book as epoch of Being (epoch coming to an end, the glow of Being in agony, a multiplication of the end, “garrulous and tenacious hypermnesia of certain moribunds,” books about the dead book)
EJQB.linkedContent: the Book as epoch of Being (epoch coming to an end, the glow of Being in agony, a multiplication of the end, “garrulous and tenacious hypermnesia of certain moribunds,” books about the dead book)

EJQB.content: Being radically outside book, its letter? > Being reveals itself only in illegibility (illisibilité)?
EJQB.linkedContent: Being radically outside book, its letter? > Being reveals itself only in illegibility (illisibilité)?

IW.content: for Cohen, Plato overprivileged vision, intuition, in determination of eidos > Cohen links German idealism to Plato’s neglected concept hypotheton: idea as hypothesis, that’s truly German, infinite task, rigorous science > idea (not as Being but as hypothesis)
IW.linkedContent: for Cohen, Plato overprivileged vision, intuition, in determination of eidos > Cohen links German idealism to Plato’s neglected concept hypotheton: idea as hypothesis, that’s truly German, infinite task, rigorous science > idea (not as Being but as hypothesis)

IW.content: Cohen translates “I am that I am” as God is Being (One), Jewish Yahweh merges w/ agathon, anhypotheton, escapes all image, perception: God is Love, Greco-Platonic Eros (at source of knowledge & aesthetic feeling) [Jew, Greek, Protestant]
IW.linkedContent: Cohen translates “I am that I am” as God is Being (One), Jewish Yahweh merges w/ agathon, anhypotheton, escapes all image, perception: God is Love, Greco-Platonic Eros (at source of knowledge & aesthetic feeling) [Jew, Greek, Protestant]

D.content: Heidegger’s Geviert, “est” tried to say what is beyond narcissism, se prend (captured) in the mirror: Being confines itself to its rature (crossing-out) comme quadrature (criss-crossing)
D.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Geviert, “est” tried to say what is beyond narcissism, se prend (captured) in the mirror: Being confines itself to its rature (crossing-out) comme quadrature (criss-crossing)

TN.content: Heidegger: from Parmenides to Husserl, sight privileged as unique access to beings & Being
TN.linkedContent: Heidegger: from Parmenides to Husserl, sight privileged as unique access to beings & Being

NOY.content: for Heidegger, the metaphysics of will: interpretation of Being as unconditional will of subjectivity—this hegemony marks all modernity (from Descartes to Hegel, to Nietzsche?)
NOY.linkedContent: for Heidegger, the metaphysics of will: interpretation of Being as unconditional will of subjectivity—this hegemony marks all modernity (from Descartes to Hegel, to Nietzsche?)

OG.content: effacement of signifier in voice is the condition of the idea of truth: ce leurre est l’histoire de la vérité, & the constituent closure: the word is lived (vécu) as elementary, indecomposable > transparent experience/expression of “être,” of word “être”
OG.linkedContent: effacement of signifier in voice is the condition of the idea of truth: ce leurre est l’histoire de la vérité, & the constituent closure: the word is lived (vécu) as elementary, indecomposable > transparent experience/expression of “être,” of word “être”

OG.content: the (transcendental) word “being” as Urwort (mot originaire) ensures “l’être-mot” to all other words [Lacan’s name-of-the-father], but “being” not reduced to word or concept: 1) modern linguistics doesn’t have to do w/ [Heideggerian] “language” 2) question of being [Seinsfrage] enclosed (unknowingly) in old linguistics of word
OG.linkedContent: the (transcendental) word “being” as Urwort (mot originaire) ensures “l’être-mot” to all other words [Lacan’s name-of-the-father], but “being” not reduced to word or concept: 1) modern linguistics doesn’t have to do w/ [Heideggerian] “language” 2) question of being [Seinsfrage] enclosed (unknowingly) in old linguistics of word

OG.content: does Heidegger transgress logocentrism of phonè by questioning being? or does the question precomprehend the word being? deconstructive breakthrough (percée) no longer circumscribed in ontic/ontological [?]
OG.linkedContent: does Heidegger transgress logocentrism of phonè by questioning being? or does the question precomprehend the word being? deconstructive breakthrough (percée) no longer circumscribed in ontic/ontological [?]

OG.content: Heidegger transgresses and contained (y est comprise) at same time in presence of logocentrism > his crossing-out (rature, kreuzweise Durchstreichung) of Being effaces presence of transcendental signified while keeping it legible: this last writing is a first writing (of an epoch), inasmuch as it de-limits onto-theology, metaphysics of presence, logocentrism > Heidegger must restore (provisionally) “transcendence” to Being to renounce project/word ontology [given risk of transgression becoming regression here, Derrida insists we go by way of Heidegger’s rigor alone]
OG.linkedContent: Heidegger transgresses and contained (y est comprise) at same time in presence of logocentrism > his crossing-out (rature, kreuzweise Durchstreichung) of Being effaces presence of transcendental signified while keeping it legible: this last writing is a first writing (of an epoch), inasmuch as it de-limits onto-theology, metaphysics of presence, logocentrism > Heidegger must restore (provisionally) “transcendence” to Being to renounce project/word ontology [given risk of transgression becoming regression here, Derrida insists we go by way of Heidegger’s rigor alone]

OG.content: Heidegger questions privilege of “infinitive” and “3rd person singular of the present indicative” [to be, is]
OG.linkedContent: Heidegger questions privilege of “infinitive” and “3rd person singular of the present indicative” [to be, is]

OG.content: [vis-à-vis Rousseau] cet être-dans-la-nature a donc le mode d’être étrange du supplément: l’être-dans makes classical logic tremble
OG.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Rousseau] cet être-dans-la-nature a donc le mode d’être étrange du supplément: l’être-dans makes classical logic tremble

EU.content: Heidegger’s move beyond responsibility for a determinate knowledge or power: must first answer to being, for the call of being—must think this coresponsibility
EU.linkedContent: Heidegger’s move beyond responsibility for a determinate knowledge or power: must first answer to being, for the call of being—must think this coresponsibility
